title: Lucy, Francis and Cousin Bill. A novel, etc
author: Wistan, Aden.
snippet: " The Montague family ? "" Yes, he's still with Lady Blanche —"" I know all the rest except the doctor's name. It's not Dr. Marshell, of North town, is it?

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The bell for last orders rang just as he stepped through the door of The Montague. He drew stares from the regulars and off-duty cops.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: The Montague establishment (25 Bedford Square) was still more notable, and as unlike this as possible ; might be defined, not quite satirically, as a most singular, social, and spiritual menagerie ; which, indeed, was well known and much noted and criticised in certain literary and other circles. Basil Montague, a chancery

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: He'd never been in The Montague before, despite living round the corner. In a neighbourhood awash with students on happy hour, it was a dull grey old man's pub, populated by halfway jakeys and off-duty coppers from St Leonard's across the road.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'Good. How about The Montague in half an hour?'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The Montague?' A note of caution in Charlie's voice.
